step1.sentence: She started keeping a weekly journal to document your progress toward her fitness goals.

step2.story: Mark decided to document his progress by taking photos every week during his home renovation. Each snapshot showed how far he had come, from bare walls to a fully finished room. Looking back at the record gave him the motivation to keep going.

step3.story: After months of learning Spanish on her own, Elena realized she had no clear sense of how much she had improved. Her tutor suggested she start a learning journal to document her progress — recording new vocabulary, grammar milestones, and short diary entries each week. At first it felt like extra work, but within a month she had a tangible record of her growth. Flipping through the pages, she could see sentences that once confused her now felt natural. The journal became more than a log; it was proof that steady effort adds up. Documenting her progress turned learning into a story she was proud to tell.

meaning.realUsageKo: 학습, 운동, 프로젝트 등 어떤 목표를 향한 과정을 체계적으로 기록할 때 사용한다. 글, 사진, 영상 등 다양한 방식이 포함될 수 있다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'document'는 라틴어 'documentum(교훈, 증거)'에서 유래했으며, 동사로는 '증거를 남기다, 기록하다'는 의미로 사용된다. 'progress'는 라틴어 'progressus(앞으로 나아감)'에서 왔다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 메모하는 것보다 더 체계적이고 의도적인 기록의 뉘앙스가 강하다. 자기 관리나 성장 맥락에서 긍정적이고 주도적인 태도를 암시한다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Use a notebook or app to document your progress each day.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 노트나 앱을 사용해 매일 진행 상황을 기록하세요.
